title: Grozny
summary: Grozny (Russian: Грозный; Chechen: Соьлжа-ГӀала, romanized: Sölƶa-Ġala) is the capital city of Chechnya, Russia. The city lies on the Sunzha River. According to the 2010 census, it had a population of 271,573[7] – up from 210,720 recorded in the 2002 census,[16] but still only about two-thirds of 399,688 recorded in the 1989 census.[17] It was previously known as Groznaya (until 1870).[3]
